intro: Monanthotaxis stenosepala, commonly known as the narrow-sepaled monanthotaxis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are often overlooked due to their modest appearance. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy in its natural habitat.
